data.message:
God... I was too hooked on love lol rocking Brian McKnight and NSYNC lmao
But Eminem was always there for me...
Like a conscience that would funnel my rage and depression...

This man is more of a father to me than my sperm donor druggie drunk dad...
He taught me poetic verse and meter.
I became able to measure my anger and depression and I started venting with poise.
I wish I could find the ability to write him an epic poem. But I found true love and I am completely happy.
It's been years since I could set pen to pad.

http://www.poetry.com/poets/47845-Tony%20Forille%20III

I wish he could read my poems and see the evolution of healing he set me on.

Thank you Eminem

Here's one I get the most compliments on.

"Ever Coming Is The Morrow"
By: Tony Forille III

I feel I am down to three possible fates 
Always on the cusp and ever at my gates 
Destined to lose memory, mind or life 
Certainly absent of anyone to call wife 
Through these passing days and at first glance 
Most may assume I never took a chance 
Though I never sought to be Brennan on the Moor 
Of bold desire, brave dreams or betrayed by a whore 
Circumstance always seems to fall upon me 
And I constantly get the worst of the three  
With the warmth of her smile, I forget how to frown 
So I try once more until she throws it down 
My heart, on the ground and felled into pieces 
And each time I find the number vastly increases 
Waiting for the next, I feel little but sorrow 
Knowing her love, could kill me tommorrow
